articles.headline: Senate Stops Consumer Nominee
articles.snippet: Republicans who opposed the creation of the agency prevented Democrats from advancing the nomination of Richard Cordray, in a challenge to one of the administration’s main responses to the financial crisis.
articles.abstract: Republicans who opposed the creation of the agency prevented Democrats from advancing the nomination of Richard Cordray, in a challenge to one of the administration’s main responses to the financial crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Senate on Thursday blocked President Obama’s nominee to head the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, as filibustering Republicans who oppose the powers of the new agency successfully challenged one of the administration’s main responses to the financial crisis.

articles.headline: Bluntly and Impatiently, Chief Upends G.M.’s Staid Tradition
articles.snippet: After 15 months in the position, Daniel Akerson, the chief executive of General Motors, has aggressively confronted a federal inquiry on the hybrid Volt and other issues.
articles.abstract: After 15 months in the position, Daniel Akerson, the chief executive of General Motors, has aggressively confronted a federal inquiry on the hybrid Volt and other issues.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Late last month, the top executives of General Motors convened for an emergency conference call. The topic: How to respond to a federal investigation of G.M.’s pride and joy, the Chevrolet Volt plug-in hybrid.

articles.headline: Settlement With Wachovia Points Up a Controversy
articles.snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission and the Justice Department reached a $148 million accord on bid-rigging charges against the bank, now part of Wells Fargo.
articles.abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission and the Justice Department reached a $148 million accord on bid-rigging charges against the bank, now part of Wells Fargo.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Securities and Exchange Commission and the Justice Department sit a little more than a mile apart in this city. But they are light-years apart in how they deal with lawbreakers on Wall Street.

articles.headline: Lines Redrawn, Longtime Allies Fight for a Seat
articles.snippet: A primary race between two popular representatives in the San Fernando Valley is the most high-profile of about a dozen intramural races resulting from once-a-decade redistricting.
articles.abstract: A primary race between two popular representatives in the San Fernando Valley is the most high-profile of about a dozen intramural races resulting from once-a-decade redistricting.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Democrat-on-Democrat warfare has returned to the San Fernando Valley.

articles.headline: Deep Roots of Fraud at Olympus
articles.snippet: The depreciation of the dollar in 1985 started a series of events that led to fraud at the Olympus Corporation, which was later uncovered because of accounting reforms caused by the Enron scandal.
articles.abstract: The depreciation of the dollar in 1985 started a series of events that led to fraud at the Olympus Corporation, which was later uncovered because of accounting reforms caused by the Enron scandal.
articles.lead_paragraph: Blame it on James A. Baker III. The “Plaza Accord” that halted the appreciation of the United States dollar in 1985 was largely his doing, as Ronald Reagan’s Treasury secretary. It set in motion a series of events that led to a huge fraud at the Olympus Corporation, the Japanese maker of cameras and medical imaging equipment, that lasted more than two decades.

articles.headline: In Tough Times, a Boom in Cremations as a Way to Save Money
articles.snippet: If current American trends hold, in 2017, more bodies will be cremated than buried, and funeral directors say the cost is a major factor in the decision.
articles.abstract: If current American trends hold, in 2017, more bodies will be cremated than buried, and funeral directors say the cost is a major factor in the decision.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Toni Kelly battled lymphoma, first with a bone marrow transplant and then with brutal rounds of chemotherapy, she worried obsessively that her four-year struggle would destroy her family’s finances.

articles.headline: China’s 10-Year Ascent to Trading Powerhouse
articles.snippet: As China celebrates its 10th anniversary since joining the World Trade Organization, the country has been reflecting on its success as a top trade partner.
articles.abstract: As China celebrates its 10th anniversary since joining the World Trade Organization, the country has been reflecting on its success as a top trade partner.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — As China heads into a weekend of speeches celebrating its 10 years as an official member of the global trade community, the rest of the world may want to contemplate the exported $49 microwave oven and the imported $85,000 Jeep Grand Cherokee.

articles.headline: German Vision Prevails as Leaders Agree on Fiscal Pact
articles.snippet: Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany persuaded every current member of the European Union except Britain to endorse tighter regional oversight of government spending.
articles.abstract: Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany persuaded every current member of the European Union except Britain to endorse tighter regional oversight of government spending.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — Europe’s worst financial crisis in generations is forging a new European Union, pushing Britain to the sidelines and creating a more integrated, fiscally disciplined core of nations under the auspices of a resurgent Germany.
articles.byline: By Steven Erlanger and Stephen Castle

articles.headline: Latest Plan for Europe Fails to Wow Investors
articles.snippet: Investors said a new fiscal plan among the 17 European Union nations using the euro would forestall a new crisis, but they worried that it did little to ease current or long-term problems.
articles.abstract: Investors said a new fiscal plan among the 17 European Union nations using the euro would forestall a new crisis, but they worried that it did little to ease current or long-term problems.
articles.lead_paragraph: Financial markets on Friday welcomed Europe’s grand new plan to bring budgetary discipline to its members but investors were skeptical that it offered any long-term fix.
